prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Summarized Context:
The witness Detective Ema explains why Trucy the defendant was accused of the murder.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: A particular set of circumstances led to her being adopted by Mr. Wright. A world-class magician on the rise.
Character 1
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The youngest lawyer in our agency. She apparently studied psychology in Europe.
Character 2
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My boss. He's taught me a lot about what it means to be a lawyer.
Character 3
Name: Bonny → Bonny de Famme
Description: A bunny-themed assistant who appeared onstage with Trucy.
Character 4
Name: Mr. Retinz → Roger Retinz
Description: A man somehow connected to the magic show. He showed up at the theater after the incident took place.
Character 5
Name: The Great Mr. Reus
Description: The victim in this case. A magician who took the stage with Trucy.
Character 6
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective. It looks like she finally became the forensic investigator she always wanted to be.
Character 7
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A prosecutor from Khura'in. He's also a monk, which explains why he's known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 8
Name: Betty de Famme
Description: A magician who performed with Trucy. She is actually Bonny's twin sister.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.
Evidence 1
Name: Stage Diagram
Description: A diagram depicting the stage where the show was performed and the understage passage.
Evidence 2
Name: Crime Photo
Description: There are traces of blood in one of the coffin's holes. It's possible the blood was placed there after the fact.
Evidence 3
Name: Fingerprinting Results
Description: In addition to prints from the victim and Bonny, Betty de Famme's fingerprints were found on the top. There is no fingerprint evidence for Trucy Wright, however.
Evidence 4
Name: Fire Bucket
Description: A bucket to be used in case of fire. Not only was it empty, but dust lines the inside of the pail.
Evidence 5
Name: Gramarye Notebook
Description: The Troupe Gramarye creed, "A true entertainer always keeps a smile on their face," is written inside.
Evidence 6
Name: Thirteen-Year-Old Poster
Description: Mr. Reus was apparently ousted from Troupe Gramarye thirteen years ago due to an injury he sustained.
Evidence 7
Name: Show Script
Description: Bonny's script. The fire trick was canceled due to the incident. The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 8
Name: Contract
Description: A contract signed by Trucy herself. It details liability for compensation.
Evidence 9
Name: Trucy's Statement
Description: Trucy moved the stage lifts to cover for Bonny's mistake. She told no one about this.
Evidence 10
Name: Sword Stand
Description: Contains the rubber sword Trucy says she swapped in for the trick.
Evidence 11
Name: Stage Lift #2
Description: The stage lift Trucy had to move out of the way during the show since it was already all the way up.
Evidence 12
Name: Show Footage
Description: A disc with a recording of Trucy's escape trick on it.
Evidence 13
Name: Clipboard
Description: The clipboard used by Trucy to sign her contract. It was also instrumental in the Ratings Rajah's dishonest dealings.
Evidence 14
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The victim's real name was Manov Mistree. His blood is on the murder weapon.
Evidence 15
Name: Prank Plan Script
Description: The corpse appearing and the set piece falling were staged by Roger Retinz.
Evidence 16
Name: Trucy's Note
Description: A note found in the dressing room after the incident that bears Trucy's signature. [caption] The note reads: "Bonny, Get the video camera after Mr. Reus comes tumbling out." The signature is exactly the same beyond human capability as that on Trucy's contract.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: The victim planned to get his revenge on Troupe Gramarye during Trucy's magic show.
Person: Ema
Testimony 1
Testimony: Mr. Reus was going to first steal the Gramarye notebook from the defendant.
Person: Ema
Testimony 2
Testimony: He then intended to reveal the secrets behind their magic tricks during the show.
Person: Ema
Testimony 3
Testimony: That was the victim's plan for revenge. And while he did, in fact, steal the notebook...
Person: Ema
Testimony 4
Testimony: ...the defendant murdered him before he had a chance to reveal the secrets.
Person: Ema
Testimony 5
Testimony: The defendant's prints were on the tape. I guess she must've moved it during the show.
Person: Ema

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let me go through each testimony and check the evidences.

Testimony 4 from Ema says that Trucy murdered the victim before he could reveal the secrets. But the evidence... Hmm. Let me look at the evidence list. 

Evidence 3 is the fingerprinting results. It says Betty's fingerprints were found on the top, but Trucy's weren't. So if Trucy's prints aren't there, but the testimony says she moved the tape (Testimony 5 mentions her prints on the tape), that might be a contradiction. Wait, Testimony 5 says her prints were on the tape, but Evidence 3 says there's no fingerprint evidence for Trucy. So that's a possible contradiction between Testimony 5 and Evidence 3.

Wait, but Testimony 5 is about the tape. Wait, in Evidence 3, the fingerprints on what? The top of the coffin? The description says "on the top". So if the testimony says Trucy's prints were on the tape, but the fingerprint evidence doesn't show hers, that's a contradiction. So Testimony 5 (Trucy's prints on tape) vs Evidence 3 (no Trucy prints). So that's a pair.

Alternatively, let's check others. Testimony 4 says Trucy murdered him. But maybe other evidence contradicts the method. For example, the Autopsy Report (14) says the victim's blood is on the murder weapon. But how does that contradict? Not sure. 

Testimony 3 says "the victim did steal the notebook... but the defendant murdered him before he could reveal secrets." Evidence 6 is the 13-year-old poster, which might relate to Mr. Reus's past but not directly contradict. 

Wait, Testimony 0 says the victim planned revenge during the show. Evidence 15 is the prank plan script by Retinz, which might show that the corpse appearing was staged, but that's Retinz's doing, not the victim's plan. Not sure.

Alternatively, Testimony 5 says Trucy's prints were on the tape, but Evidence 3 states that Trucy's fingerprints were not found. So if the testimony claims she left prints on the tape (maybe the murder weapon or some critical item), but the evidence shows no prints, that's a contradiction. So that pair would be Testimony 5 (prints on tape) vs Evidence 3 (no prints). So the answer would be {"evidence": 3, "testimony":5}.

{"evidence": 3, "testimony": 5}

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: It's true. I had business in the understage passage because of the upcoming trick.
Person: Betty
Testimony 1
Testimony: It was the fire trick, right? The one Mr. Reus was supposed to do?
Person: Bonny
Testimony 2
Testimony: That's right. It's a very dangerous trick, so I had to make sure we were prepared for it.
Person: Betty
Testimony 3
Testimony: I-It was in the script... and I really wanted to see it... but I couldn't because of the accident.
Person: Bonny
Testimony 4
Testimony: Shut up! You're gonna give it away! ...Anyway, I was real busy.
Person: Betty
Testimony 5
Testimony: Yeah... Way too busy to have the chance to kill Mr. Reus...
Person: Bonny

response:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. I need to go through each testimony and check against the evidence to find a contradiction.

First, looking at the testimonies. Betty and Bonny are the ones testifying. Let's check each one. 

Testimony 0 from Betty says she was in the understage passage for the upcoming trick, which was the fire trick according to Bonny's Testimony 1. The fire trick required the fire bucket to be prepared, as per the Show Script (Evidence 7). But the Fire Bucket (Evidence 4) is empty and dusty, which means it wasn't prepared. That contradicts Betty's Testimony 2 where she says she made sure they were prepared. Because if the bucket was empty and dusty, they weren't prepared. 

Wait, Testimony 2 by Betty: "That's right. It's a very dangerous trick, so I had to make sure we were prepared for it." But Evidence 4 shows the fire bucket was empty and dusty. So if they were prepared, the bucket should have been ready, not empty. So that's a contradiction between Testimony 2 and Evidence 4.

Another possible point: Testimony 5 from Bonny says she was too busy to kill Mr. Reus. But the fingerprint results (Evidence 3) show Betty's fingerprints on the top, along with the victim and Bonny. Maybe Bonny's prints being there could relate, but I think the main contradiction is between Betty's Testimony 2 and the Fire Bucket evidence. Because she claimed they were prepared for the fire trick, but the bucket wasn't ready. That's a direct contradiction. So Evidence 4 contradicts Testimony 2. 

Yes, that seems right. The prepared fire trick needs the bucket ready, but the bucket was empty and dusty, proving they weren't prepared. So Betty's testimony about being prepared is false.

{"evidence": 4, "testimony": 2}
